law.catch_line: Definition of "deaf-blind children" for KRS 167.210 to 167.240.
law.text: As used in KRS 167.210 to 167.240, unless the context otherwise requires, "deaf-blind children" are those children who are deaf or hard of hearing and have visual impairments, the combination of which causes such severe communication, developmental, and educational problems that they cannot profit satisfactorily from educational programs provided solely for the child with a visual disability or for the child with a hearing disability.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 405, sec. 32, effective July 15, 1994. â€“ Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 144, sec. 11, effective July 14, 1992. -- Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 600, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 87, sec. 1.
